verses.verse: Oh that<WH3863> thou wouldest rend<WH7167> the heavens,<WH8064> that thou wouldest come down,<WH3381> that the mountains<WH2022> might flow down<WH2151> at thy presence,<WH4480> <WH6440>

As when the melting<WH2003> fire<WH784> burneth,<WH6919> the fire<WH784> causeth the waters<WH4325> to boil,<WH1158> to make thy name<WH8034> known<WH3045> to thine adversaries,<WH6862> that the nations<WH1471> may tremble<WH7264> at thy presence!<WH4480> <WH6440>
When thou didst<WH6213> terrible things<WH3372> which we looked not for,<WH6960> <WH3808> thou camest down,<WH3381> the mountains<WH2022> flowed down<WH2151> at thy presence.<WH4480> <WH6440>

For since the beginning of the world<WH4480> <WH5769> men have not<WH3808> heard,<WH8085> nor<WH3808> perceived by the ear,<WH238> neither<WH3808> hath the eye<WH5869> seen,<WH7200> O God,<WH430> beside<WH2108> thee, what he hath prepared<WH6213> for him that waiteth<WH2442> for him.

Thou meetest<WH6293> <WH853> him that rejoiceth<WH7797> and worketh<WH6213> righteousness,<WH6664> those that remember<WH2142> thee in thy ways:<WH1870> behold,<WH2005> thou<WH859> art wroth;<WH7107> for we have sinned:<WH2398> in those is continuance,<WH5769> and we shall be saved.<WH3467>

But we are<WH1961> all<WH3605> as an unclean<WH2931> thing, and all<WH3605> our righteousnesses<WH6666> are as filthy<WH5708> rags;<WH899> and we all<WH3605> do fade<WH5034> as a leaf;<WH5929> and our iniquities,<WH5771> like the wind,<WH7307> have taken us away.<WH5375>

And there is none<WH369> that calleth<WH7121> upon thy name,<WH8034> that stirreth up himself<WH5782> to take hold<WH2388> of thee: for<WH3588> thou hast hid<WH5641> thy face<WH6440> from<WH4480> us, and hast consumed<WH4127> us, because<WH3027> of our iniquities.<WH5771>
But now,<WH6258> O LORD,<WH3068> thou<WH859> art our father;<WH1> we<WH587> are the clay,<WH2563> and thou<WH859> our potter;<WH3335> and we all<WH3605> are the work<WH4639> of thy hand.<WH3027>

Be not wroth<WH7107> <WH408> very sore,<WH5704> <WH3966> O LORD,<WH3068> neither<WH408> remember<WH2142> iniquity<WH5771> forever:<WH5703> behold,<WH2005> see,<WH5027> we beseech thee,<WH4994> we are all<WH3605> thy people.<WH5971>
Thy holy<WH6944> cities<WH5892> are<WH1961> a wilderness,<WH4057> Zion<WH6726> is<WH1961> a wilderness,<WH4057> Jerusalem<WH3389> a desolation.<WH8077>

Our holy<WH6944> and our beautiful<WH8597> house,<WH1004> where<WH834> our fathers<WH1> praised<WH1984> thee, is<WH1961> burned up<WH8316> with fire:<WH784> and all<WH3605> our pleasant things<WH4261> are<WH1961> laid waste.<WH2723>
Wilt thou refrain thyself<WH662> for<WH5921> these<WH428> things, O LORD?<WH3068> wilt thou hold thy peace,<WH2814> and afflict<WH6031> us very sore?<WH5704> <WH3966>
